required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Rifampicin on the Pharmacokinetics of SHR6390 in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-centre, Open, Single-dose, Self-control Study to Investigate the Effect of Rifampicin on the Pharmacokinetics of SHR6390 in Healthy Chinese Adult Subjects.

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the effect of rifampicin on pharmacokinetics of healthy Chinese adult subjects after oral administration of SHR6390 tablets. The secondary objective of the study is to evaluate the safety of SHR6390 alone and when co-administered with rifampicin.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 32 days
through study completion, an average of 32 days
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of SHR6390

secondary_outcome.time_frame: :through study completion, an average of 32 days
secondary_outcome.description: Time of maximum observed concentration (Tmax) of SHR6390

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 32 days

arm_group.description: subjects receiving a single oral dose of SHR6390 tablets, then rifampicin capsules 600 mg/day orally with a single oral dose of SHR6390 tablets co-administered.

intervention.intervention_name: SHR6390 tablet single oral dose of SHR6390 or co-administered with rifampicin
intervention.description: 600 mg rifampicin was administered in the morning.
